A washed-up, alcoholic country singer awakens at a run-down roadside motel and gas station after a night of heavy drinking. He meets the owner, a young widow, and offers to perform maintenance work in exchange for a room. The widow, whose husband died in a war, is raising her young son on her own. She agrees to let him stay on condition that he does not drink while working. During quiet evenings, they sit alone and share parts of their life stories. The singer resolves to give up alcohol and start his life anew. After enough days of keeping his word and doing his work, he is comfortable enough in his new life that he and the widow wed. They start attending a local church on a regular basis.

A newspaper reporter eventually visits the motel and asks the singer whether he has stopped recording music and if he has deliberately chosen to lead an anonymous life. When he refuses to answer, the reporter explains he is writing a story about him and has interviewed his ex-wife, a country music star who is performing nearby. After the story is published, the neighbourhood learns of his past, and members of a local country-western band visit him to show their respect. Despite greeting them politely, he remains reluctant to open up about his past.

Later, he secretly attends his ex-wife's concert. She passionately sings songs he wrote years earlier, and he leaves in the middle of the performance. Backstage, he talks to her manager, his old friend. He gives him a copy of a new song he has written and asks him to show it to his ex-wife. He tries to talk to her, who becomes angry and warns him to stay away from their teenage daughter.

The story continues with complex family dynamics, including reconciliation attempts, personal struggles with alcoholism, and eventual redemption. The singer forms a strong bond with his new wife's son, performs music again, and confronts his painful past. Tragedy strikes when his daughter dies in a car accident, leading to a poignant funeral scene. Despite this loss, he finds meaning in his new life, playing catch with his stepson and finding peace in his transformed existence.
